Package tasks

Class TaskSorter

java.lang.Object
tasks.TaskSorter
public class TaskSorter extends Object
A TaskSorter is a class that can store tasks and dependencies between them, as well as order the tasks in a way such that each task appears before any other tasks that it depends on (assuming that is possible).

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    TaskSorter()
    Creates a new TaskSorter object with no added tasks or dependencies.

  • Constructor Details

    • TaskSorter

      public TaskSorter()
      Creates a new TaskSorter object with no added tasks or dependencies.

  • Method Details

    • addTask

      public void addTask(Task t)
      Adds a new Task to the TaskSorter. If the task is already included, then this will do nothing.
      Parameters:
      t - Task to be added
      Requires:
      t != null

    • getTasks

      public Set<Task> getTasks()
      Returns a set containing all tasks in the sorter
      Returns:
      A set of all tasks in this TaskSorter.

    • addDependency

      public void addDependency(Dependency dep)
      Adds a new Dependency to the TaskSorter. If the dependency is already added, then this will do nothing.
      Parameters:
      dep - Dependency to be added
      Requires:
      dep != null and dep's before and after tasks are already added

    • getOutgoingDependencies

      public Set<Dependency> getOutgoingDependencies(Task t)
      Given a Task, finds the dependencies that have the given task as a prerequisite (the "before" task of the dependency).
      Parameters:
      t - the task to search for in the dependencies
      Returns:
      set of dependencies with t as the "before" task
      Requires:
      t != null and t has already been added as a task

    • sortTasks

      public List<Task> sortTasks()
      Returns a list of the dependencies in an order that has the "before" task of any dependency appearing before the "after" task. If multiple orders are possible, this method prioritizes tasks with names that are alphabetically earlier. If there is a cycle of dependencies, meaning that no such ordering is possible, then this returns null.
      Returns:
      List of all tasks that respects the ordering requirements of the dependencies or null if no such ordering is possible.
